item.title: tan⁻¹(x) = cot⁻¹(1/x)
item.description:
To prove that \(\tan^{-1}(x) = \cot^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)\), let’s proceed step by step.

Step 1: Define the Inverse Tangent

\[ \theta = \tan^{-1}(x) \]\[ \tan\theta = x \]

Step 2: Express the Cotangent of Another Angle

\[ \phi = \cot^{-1}\left(\frac{1}{x}\right) \]\[ \cot\phi = \frac{1}{x} \]

Step 3: Use Reciprocal Identity of Tangent and Cotangent

\[ \tan\theta = x \quad \Rightarrow \quad \tan\theta = \frac{\text{opposite}}{\text{adjacent}} \]\[ \cot\phi = \frac{\text{adjacent}}{\text{opposite}} = \frac{1}{x} \]
